message.content:
Below is one workable interpretation of how to replicate the two towers in the main image using only the blocks (in the exact orientations) shown in the dictionary.  The key is to notice that the large “circular‐window” cube on the right tower can be formed by four Red half‐arch blocks (dictionary #1) arranged in a square so that their arches meet in the center.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall there are two separate towers:

LEFT TOWER
 •  Bottom Layer:  
    – Two vertical Orange cylinders (front).  
    – A taller stack of Orange cylinders (two segments) behind them.  
 •  Second Layer:  
    – A Yellow rectangular beam bridging across the two front cylinders.  
 •  Above That Beam (right side):  
    – One Red half‐arch block.  
    – An Orange wedge “roof” set on top of the arch.  
 •  Very Top (behind):  
    – A second Orange wedge “roof” on top of the tall rear cylinder stack.

RIGHT TOWER
 •  Bottom Yellow beam lying flat on the ground.  
 •  Above it, a “cube” with a circular window formed by FOUR Red half‐arch blocks arranged in a ring.  
 •  Another Yellow beam on top of that ring.  
 •  Two more vertical Orange cylinders supporting a third Yellow beam.  
 •  A final Orange wedge “roof” capping the top.

•  LAYER COUNT / TOTAL BLOCKS
   – Left tower uses 8 blocks:  
       4 Orange cylinders (#5),  
       1 Yellow beam (#3),  
       1 Red half‐arch (#1),  
       2 Orange wedges (any two from #13–#16).  
   – Right tower uses 10 blocks:  
       1 Yellow beam (#3) at the bottom,  
       4 Red half‐arches (#1) for the “window” ring,  
       1 Yellow beam (#3) above that ring,  
       2 Orange cylinders (#5),  
       1 Yellow beam (#3) on top of the cylinders,  
       1 Orange wedge (from #13–#16).  
   – Total across both towers: 18 blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
You will need the following dictionary indices (no rotation other than shown):

•  #1  (Red half‐arch)  
   – 5 copies total  
   – 1 for the small arch on the left tower  
   – 4 to form the circular “window” piece on the right tower  
•  #3  (Yellow rectangular block in horizontal orientation)  
   – 4 copies total (3 for the right tower, 1 for the left)  
•  #5  (Orange cylinder in vertical orientation)  
   – 6 copies total (4 for the left tower, 2 for the right)  
•  Any 3  of  {#13, #14, #15, #16}  (Orange wedge “roof” blocks)  
   – The main image has 3 separate triangular roofs.  
   – Choose whichever three wedge indices match the orientation you see.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is a sample build sequence (you may vary the exact order as long as each higher piece rests on a completed layer).  For brevity, we refer to wedges as Wx (one of #13–#16).

{
  Step1:  Move block with index  #5   (place left‐front cylinder of left tower)
  Step2:  Move block with index  #5   (place right‐front cylinder of left tower)
  Step3:  Move block with index  #5   (place rear‐lower cylinder of left tower)
  Step4:  Move block with index  #5   (stack rear‐upper cylinder of left tower)
  Step5:  Move block with index  #3   (bridge across front cylinders of left tower)
  Step6:  Move block with index  #1   (red half‐arch atop bridge, left tower)
  Step7:  Move block with index  Wx   (orange wedge roof on arch, left tower)
  Step8:  Move block with index  Wx   (orange wedge on top of tall rear column)

  Step9:  Move block with index  #3   (bottom yellow beam of right tower)
  Step10: Move block with index  #1   (1st red half‐arch for “window” ring)
  Step11: Move block with index  #1   (2nd red half‐arch for “window” ring)
  Step12: Move block with index  #1   (3rd red half‐arch for “window” ring)
  Step13: Move block with index  #1   (4th red half‐arch to complete ring)
  Step14: Move block with index  #3   (yellow beam on top of arch ring)
  Step15: Move block with index  #5   (left cylinder above ring)
  Step16: Move block with index  #5   (right cylinder above ring)
  Step17: Move block with index  #3   (yellow beam bridging those two cylinders)
  Step18: Move block with index  Wx   (final orange wedge roof at the top)
}

That set of blocks (used in that rough bottom‐to‐top order) will re‐create the two towers as shown in the main image.
